dc:title: C. W. Editor Calls On G. M. Strikers In Plant at Flint
dc:author: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Supports the sit-down strike as a nonviolent tactic in labor organizing. Describes in detail a visit to strikers against General Motors in Flint, Michigan. Notes Communists take advantage of strikes to promote their philosophy of life and calls for Catholics to become "apostles of labor" to reach the masses.
